channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Brew Crossword: VP Pun-dits
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: 2020 U.S. Consumer Habits Mystify Finance Biz
item.description: Consumer loan bonds outpaced junk bonds, corporate loans, and mortgage-backed securities .   You’d be wrong  U.S. consumers are in fine form—by some measures. In the wake of the 2008 financial crisis, consumer lending firms suffered losses of 60%–70%, according to consumer lending firm OneMain’s chief risk officer. This year has not been an easy one to be a business writer—though I’m lucky to have remained employed and many people’s jobs are way more challenging than mine.     So...   How do we know that? Those are a class of “asset-backed securities,” or financial instruments that bet on an asset, like a consumer loan, yielding a return. Plus, in the quarantine era, there just isn’t as much to spend money on. what does it all mean? big time.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Housing Boom Continues to Expand, According to Existing Home Sales Data
item.description: The median price of an existing home last month was $313,000, 15% higher than a year ago.   A combo of factors is driving the housing boom: Homes are the new offices, considering at least 21% of the labor force is working from home because of the pandemic.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Electric Vehicle Roundup: GM Ups Investments, UK Accelerates Gas Vehicle Ban
item.description: Finally, shares rose for Chinese EV makers Nio, Xpeng Motors, and Li Auto after they posted Q3 earnings this week.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Unemployment Claims Rise for First Time in 5 Weeks
item.description: The other provides an additional 13 weeks of federal benefits after state ones run out. Congress missed the sentiment behind Boxing Day. On Dec. 26, two CARES Act programs that offer additional federal unemployment benefits will expire: One expands eligibility to contract workers and the self-employed for the first time.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: BuzzFeed to Acquire HuffPost in Broader Partnership With Owner Verizon Media
item.description: In the 2000s, brands like BuzzFeed and The Huffington Post (HuffPost's initial name) attracted eyeballs aplenty—and with them, ad dollars.   HuffPost owner Verizon Media will reportedly make a cash investment in BuzzFeed, plus nab a minority stake that values BuzzFeed at a reported $1.7 billion.     Add this to the list of accelerating trends  The trend here being consolidation in digital media.   Last year alone, Vox Media acquired New York Magazine's parent company, Vice Media acquired Refinery29, and Group Nine bought PopSugar.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: November 20
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.description: Finally, shares rose for Chinese EV makers Nio, Xpeng Motors, and Li Auto after they posted Q3 earnings this week.   SPACs are back.

On Dec. 26, two CARES Act programs that offer additional federal unemployment benefits will expire: One expands eligibility to contract workers and the self-employed for the first time.

item.description: The median price of an existing home last month was $313,000, 15% higher than a year ago.   A combo of factors is driving the housing boom: Homes are the new offices, considering at least 21% of the labor force is working from home because of the pandemic.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Essentials, Issue #83: Goodbye, hello
item.description: R&R    alvarez / Getty Images Start with dessert: Candace Nelson, founder of Sprinkles Cupcakes, is hosting a virtual pie pop-up—a holiday pie-making course designed to turn you into a baking mastermind.   The origin story of the Ratatousical.   Your internet Sidekick, Rachel    -----  See you on Monday.   Happy Place    Cavan Images / Getty Images It was prime parka weather in Chicago on Tuesday morning—a crisp 28 degrees, which reminded me that I had planned to teleport to Tucson, Arizona, this winter.   Dept.   Show time: Just because you’re famous doesn’t mean you’re a good podcast host. Leading Off    Giphy My “For You” page on TikTok: Target hauls, healthy cooking tips, and Ratatouille The Musical.   Conversations with the masterminds behind this musical adaption of one of Pixar’s most underrated animated films.   Now the musical has a behind-the-scenes crew, including a stage manager and a tech team.   Bingeworthy: Now is the ideal time to mooch off your friend’s HBO Max account.   First draft: For a good laugh, here are the first lines of rejected “Modern Love” essays.
item.author: Rachel Cantor

item.title: Social Media Startup Yubo Has a Unique Business Model
item.description: It’s doing a lot more than just copying Snap stories.   How it makes money: Yubo is completely ad-free. In between chats, users can swipe left or right to add friends, similar to Tinder. The app consists of a variety of “rooms” users can enter to videochat with friends or strangers.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Apple to Shrink App Store Fees—For Certain Developers
item.description: Who counts as small: Those that generate $1 million or less in annual revenue (after Apple takes its 15% chunk).   Bottom line: The App Store is essential to Apple’s long-term strategy, but it’s also been the center of antitrust allegations in both the U.S. and the EU.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Google Rolls Out New, All-in-One Payments App
item.description: Bottom line: Google’s app will shine if you opt into its advanced features like allowing it to scan your Gmail inbox or Google Photos account to look for receipts. The tech giant rolled out a revamped Google Pay app yesterday highlighted by a new peer-to-peer payments system. Google says no.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Covid-19: States and Cities Reimpose Restrictions to Curb Infection Rates
item.description: As the coronavirus sweeps across the country, states and cities are re-implementing restrictions on businesses and social life to curb infection numbers. Here’s some advice from experts. with Thanksgiving approaching, the No. 1 topic of conversation in our group chats is, “Should I go home for the holiday?”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Boeing’s 737 Max Cleared for Takeoff
item.description: And it features many superlatives:  Longest grounding of a jet in U.S. history  By far the worst crisis in Boeing’s 100+ year history Considering the 737 Max was the bestselling plane from the U.S.’ preeminent industrial company, some consider it to be the country’s most important manufacturing product. In March 2019, aviation regulators around the world said the jet couldn’t fly again until Boeing and the FAA figured out what went wrong... In an unofficial poll on Morning Brew’s Twitter account, 54% of respondents said they wouldn’t fly on a 737 Max.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Bitcoin Closes in on Its All Time High After Latest Rally
item.description: Whereas in late 2017 you couldn't go two Morning Brew newsletters without seeing a bitcoin headline, the conversation this time around has been tamer.   Crypto bulls think that reflects a more sustainable path forward, rather than the wild speculation that drove prices higher three Thanksgivings ago.     Ray Dalio is not one of them.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Senate Committee Grills Zuckerberg, Dorsey
item.description: Zuckerberg said Facebook's ultra-sophisticated algorithms can be deployed to tackle the issues lawmakers raised. To channel Michael Barbaro… Here's what  you need  toknowabout it:  Republican lawmakers were most concerned about the platforms' content moderation policies, imploring the CEOs to intervene less in user activity.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Amazon Dives Into Healthcare With Drug Delivery Service
item.description: How it works: Customers can use the Amazon app or website to order prescription drugs.   OK, so Amazon actually waded into healthcare a while ago—it bought online pharmacy PillPack in 2018. But this is a much bigger initiative.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Senate Blocks Trump's Controversial Fed Nominee, Judy Shelton
item.description: Judy Shelton, President Trump's nominee for the Federal Reserve's Board of Governors, was rejected in a 50–47 vote on the Senate floor yesterday. Learn more about what they do and who's in charge in the Brew's Fed diversity map. Looking ahead...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Walmart, Home Depot Beat on Earnings
item.description: First up, Walmart In Q3, e-commerce sales at the world's biggest retailer surged 79% and profits 56%—impressive numbers despite a subdued back-to-school season and the petering out of government stimulus.   Other retail categories, like apparel, haven't been so lucky.   Pulse check: Home Depot and Walmart are situated in retail categories that have remained bright spots for consumer spending amid the pandemic—household essentials and home improvement.   And overall, October retail sales eked out 0.3% growth, below expectations and September's 1.6% gain.   + For more stories like this...   What's next?
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Bitcoin Closes in on Its All Time High After Latest Rally
item.description: Whereas in late 2017 you couldn't go two Morning Brew newsletters without seeing a bitcoin headline, the conversation this time around has been tamer.   Crypto bulls think that reflects a more sustainable path forward, rather than the wild speculation that drove prices higher three Thanksgivings ago.     Ray Dalio is not one of them.

item.title: Small Company, Big Moves: A Guide to Disruptive Investing
item.description: It’s more important to focus on companies who are disrupting industries that will be around for the long haul.   The world is changing faster than ever, and with the right companies in your portfolio, you can be one of the people helping it change for the better.   And as more and more of these organizations look to IPO or woo investors, learning what to look for can be the difference between spotting a unicorn and riding something into the ground. If it’s a new industry, who’s name do you hear over and over?   This is also the time to really take a look at the leader of this company.   Disrupt Smartly There are no sure things, and that is especially true when investing in small, innovative companies.   So we asked our investing friends at The Motley Fool to help us know what to look for before we get disruptive with our investing. There are no shortage of companies claiming to be disrupting something.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: Jay Clayton is Stepping Down as Chairman of the SEC, but Succession Plans are Murky
item.description: top candidates for the role under Biden will probably lean more toward Miss Trunchbull than Ned Schneebly when it comes to keeping Wall Street's excesses in check.   Looking ahead...
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Actors Ryan Reynolds and Will McElhenney Buy Small Welsh Soccer Club
item.description: Blake Lively's husband and notable Canadian, Ryan Reynolds, has teamed up with It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia co-creator Rob McElhenney to buy the Welsh soccer team Wrexham AFC.   Get to know Wrexham  Although currently languishing in the fifth tier of English professional soccer, Wrexham has a rich history.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Tesla to Join S&P in December
item.description: They’ll announce what company Tesla is booting off at a later date.   Who’s your money on?
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Obama Memoir Released as Booksellers Grapple With Pandemic
item.description: The big question: Will Barack top his wife Michelle's 2018 memoir, Becoming, which has sold 14+ million copies globally?   The famous Strand bookstore in NYC said sales dropped 70% from last year. Barack Obama's latest memoir, A Promised Land, goes on sale today. We hear there's a steak dinner on the line.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Moderna Vaccine Was 95% Effective in Phase 3 Trials
item.description: Plus, Moderna's vaccine can hold for a month at a normal refrigerator freezer's temp, making it much easier to transport than Pfizer's, which requires -94°F.   The details: Moderna's month-long trial involved 30,000 volunteers split between placebo and vaccine groups. That rally comes despite rising U.S. cases and new restrictions, which could disproportionately hurt small-cap's profits this quarter, the WSJ reports. Yesterday, Moderna announced its vaccine was 94.5% effective in Phase 3 clinical trials, just one week after Pfizer bragged its vaccine was over 90% effective.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Airbnb Discloses IPO Filing in a Startling Comeback
item.description: Yesterday, home rental company Airbnb released its long-awaited IPO filing.   + If you've got some time on your hands... Expedia CEO Peter Kern, for one, gave a bullish take to Bloomberg recently: "Rome has been through a plague or two."
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Essentials, Issue #82: Big news
item.description: --------  I’m counting down the days till the first Sidekick edition.    Thanksgiving setup:    While everyone else is stressing over their turkeys and pumpkin pies, here are 12 things to do if you’re on your own this Thanksgiving.     Happy Place    owngarden / Getty Images This week’s Happy Place is brought to you by Essentials reader Phil K.   Dept.   R&R    © eleonora galli / Getty Images Tidy up: All over Instagram, people are ROYGBIV-ing their medicine cabinets, fridges, and bookshelves.   Offline: Count the number of times you’ve deleted Instagram only to re-download it 20 minutes later.   A Hallmark movie bingo board and a drinking game.   Hallmark’s first gay holiday flick is arriving November 22.    Stay Sharp  Self-improvement: Learn how to spot unhealthy perfectionism and get over “never good enough.” Leading Off   Giphy If you’re watching a movie and a) there’s a big holiday festival in town b) two characters almost kiss but get interrupted, or c) the main character’s name is Holly or Nick, then you’re most likely watching a Hallmark film.
item.author: Rachel Cantor
